body:
In general, non-tuple indices are wrapped in a tuple. That's the `PyTuple_Pack` case. So `x[3]` is equivalent to `x[(3,)]` (although integer indices are fast-tracked below).

The heuristic-based "backwards-compatibility" behavior is to treat some sequences as tuples. `PySequence_Tuple ` converts the index to a tuple instead of wrapping it. So in these cases `x[idx]` is equivalent to `x[tuple(idx)]` instead of `x[(idx,)]`

In general, non-tuple indices are wrapped in a tuple. That's the PyTuple_Pack case. So x[3] is equivalent to x[(3,)] (although integer indices are fast-tracked below).
